reviews.text: Was extualy close at night, and there were a lots of dogs around! But from out side it was a standing place! Really beautiful
A lovely temple in Mae Sot, well worth a visit!
Beautiful temple building by Burmese Artice
This is the Wat,best in Mae Sot.
Beautiful nice temple
Good to take your shoes off and soak your feet in the hot water. The only downside is, it's not maintained and clearly falling apart from it's age.

(LONG WAY DO NOT WALK OR TRY TO GO BY PUSHBIKE)🗻
You need a car or motorbike to get here
Took me
1hr 30 mins to get there 
Bring food (unless you love chillies)
You can buy eggs to cook 3/4hour it took!
The water is to hot to put your feet in
But you can hire rooms as in photos cheap☺
On the main highway next to 7/11 are a few thai food stalls were you can eat
The land on the way is very lush
Also there are a lot of 1baht water machines along the way you can fill a bottle with cold water🗻
Very little English spoken or writen
Mostly Thai visitors
You will need at lest 4to5hrs to enjoy this trip from start to finnish♢
Very few people who are not from Asia have visited here if you want to cure some pains then bath in the waters🗻
Worthy place to visit
Source d'eau (très) chaude. Endroit sympa. Pourrait être mieux mis en valeur. Environnement, entretien général moyen. Vous apprécierez un bain de pieds dans l'eau de source. Personnel accueillant.

reviews.author_name: สมจริง แซ่เลิ้ม
reviews.text:
ต้องปรับปรุงอีกเยอะแต่ร้านขายข้าวข้างใน
อร่อยอัฒยาศัยดีราคาถูก

This place has a beautiful waterfall with shallow water. if the weather is nice you can take a short hike or a long hike it depending on your pleasure. The sounds of the water, nature, and absence of city life are very calming so plan to stay for a little while. Tourists are charged a bit more the locals, so be prepared to pay a small fee upon entrance.
Toilet is clean. This is alcohol free zone,  which is very good. One can feel natural.

One of the most beautiful waterfall in Tak after the famous Thor Lu Su Waterfall in Umphang. You can see the steps of falls from the top to the bottom streams. No entry charges. There was a cafe if you wanna quenched your thirst too. Drop by here if you are around the area.
Lots of space even if there is a crowd. Nice coffee shop and of course a great waterfall
Ecellent food at the restaurant. Very nice park and waterfall.

Always a beautiful meal here and the steak is always perfectly cooked (medium rare). Lovely service, we have a family meal here for most of the big birthdays. Glad Dumfries still has somewhere like this.
Decent. Food was ok but underwhelming... Dishes ordered were chosen with high expectations but minimal flavour coming through and tough meat let it down. Chips were nice. Well presented too.
Delightful  fresh food. Gorgeous  desserts. Friendly  helpful staff.  A nice place to meet friend's  for a relaxing lunch , no time pressure  to vacate the table.
Superb Monday lunch, three courses and a beer with the wife. Brilliant can't recommend highly enough. Good sized portions and fantastic service.
We were down from Edinburgh we had been recommended this restaurant by friends, it is a hidden gem , lovely food , friendly staff and beautiful surroundings, will definitely be back
Always a pleasure to spend time at Braverly.  It's a blessing to be able to support young people in making their lives better.  Delicious food and one of the best drip coffees in MaeSot
Biggest cup of coffee on town. Always improving thier service.
Me and my kids love coming to Braverly for smoothie bowls and bagels. They've got great food.
Great atmosphere and service!

Got a pork burger. It was a litle to the rare side, but I was hungry. The place is not super, but hard to find other restaurants with a litle western dishes.
Now you can find better ones in Robinson. 
Do not get any Michelin star.
Beer times are strictly enforced. 
Observe the opening hours.
Good large portions, hard-to-come-by genuine western food in this part of Thailand. Owner is from Toronto, very friendly and helpful.
Found this place by chance... excellent host and great food. Will be back next time in the area.

Wonderful meal and great advice!
Great food , big menu, we ate Mexican and Thai spot on, big bottles of beer 70 B, need local info just ask, gave us a great lead on a hotel! Was a bit surprised to see that the restaurant had closed the bar extension but it was explained that the town had become very slow with many expats moving into Burma.
Choice in the menu including Mexican specialities, Thai food and different western options. Moderate price
Had plenty of Thai food over the years but I have to say mai thai is absolutely amazing. So authentic, so much flavour and cooked to perfection. Definitely be back. Wayne from South Wales 👍
It was delicious, we had the set meal for two, just about managed to eat it all. The waitress was friendly and helpful and the service was really good.

I'm really sad to say our visit to Mai Thia was very disappointing. We had a set meal. Our starters we lovely but we had a 'soup' and main dishes were basically tasteless except for the beef dish which had an overpowering aniseed flavour. Lemongrass had been chopped into the dishes therefore every mouthful you had, you were picking the hard lemongrass out. I did mention to the waitress this wasn't to my liking but she said that's what Thia food is like! The dessert was banana fritters, and like the starter thus was nice. I love Thia food and have had the pleasure of eating in a few Thia restusrants but Mai Thia really has a different take on This food!! If this was your first experience of Thia food, I don't think you would want to eat Thia again.
Wonderful food and service, plus free parking outside.
Lovely authentic Thai restaurant. Friendly staff, generous portions, great food. Nice laid-back vibe -- a lovely neighbourhood restaurant.

A cozy spot with lovely garden view for a fresh juice, ice cream or meal. Western breakfast (eg omelettes) on offer all day, grilled cheese toast with various toppings, and an extensive Western and Thai menu. Ingredients are super fresh, the space is airy and light-filled, service is quick and friendly.
Well prepared, clean and delocious food with reasonanle prices. Wide variety of food selection. Restaurant is clean and comfortable, Recommended.

ughh.. it was soooo good. food was really good as well as the drinks 

( I ate the chicken sandwich, basil chicken with fried egg n rice n their Thai milk tea is.. 😍😍so good, n their honey toast with ice cream ugh so good.. )
We have some Thai sweet
A nice meal in air conditioning.

Very nice meal, but closing end of September 2017.
We ate here or last night in town, the food is very Burmese and tasty but different than any Burmese food we have had before. We had the waitress suggest some dishes and the meal was lovely. She mentioned that they were closing by the end of September and moving to Burma.

Best Burmese restaurant in Mae Sot. Very reasonably priced. It is almost like a family house with tables in the front garden where you eat. Lots of mosquitoes, so use repellent. Interesting dishes you may not find elsewhere in Thailand. Definitely a great place to eat.
Great Burmese salads and curry. Smoothies are good. Outdoor seating

Best Burmese food I have had ever.
Great prices also

You tell me where's the best place to do it when you're hungry and I tell you straight --- WADEE!!! Packed with delicious and nutritious delis plus courteous Myanmar owners and staffs makes the place an ideal family resto to go. Must visit when in Maesot.
Always a pleasure to spend time at Braverly.  It's a blessing to be able to support young people in making their lives better.  Delicious food and one of the best drip coffees in MaeSot
Biggest cup of coffee on town. Always improving thier service.
Me and my kids love coming to Braverly for smoothie bowls and bagels. They've got great food.
Great atmosphere and service!
